title: TOD & Parking Mandate Repeal: Cross-Sectoral Systems Map
description: Abolish parking minimums + mandate 50% housing within 1km transit

nodes.label: Transport
nodes.description: TOD & Parking Repeal: 50% housing within 1km transit, abolish parking minimums

nodes.label: Buildings
nodes.description: Development patterns, parking infrastructure, construction costs

nodes.label: Urban Development
nodes.description: Land use, density patterns, real estate values

nodes.label: Energy
nodes.description: Transport energy demand, modal shift impacts

nodes.label: Biodiversity
nodes.description: Urban sprawl, habitat preservation, green space

links.quantification: Parking repeal → 20% construction cost reduction → ₹10L/unit savings → affordable housing becomes viable
TOD mandate → 50% new housing near transit → reduces urban sprawl by 30% → compact city development
Less parking → 20% more ground-floor retail → walkable neighborhoods → 40% increase in foot traffic
Transit-oriented living → 40% fewer car trips → 12 MT fuel saved annually → reduces transport energy demand
Developer resistance: Parking drives sales → buyers demand parking → market pressure against mandate repeal
Car owner pushback: 10-year lag to stock turnover → existing residents resist parking reduction → NIMBYism
TOD → density → walkability → less car dependency → more TOD demand → virtuous cycle of compact development
Requires transit quality: TOD only works with <10 min frequency + <500m walk distance → infrastructure before mandate
Via anti-sprawl: 30% less sprawl → preserved peri-urban forests → habitat conservation → biodiversity protection
Via cost savings: ₹10L/unit savings → affordable housing → economic diversity → inclusive neighborhoods
